# The `X86ISelLoweringCall.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file implements the lowering of LLVM calls to DAG nodes. <a href="#details">More...</a>

This is not fatal, unlike report&#95;fatal&#95;error, so calling code should attempt to recover without crashing.

### getv64i1Argument() {#a49816805ae1abf4f4a01546d06c413a5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static SDValue getv64i1Argument (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign">CCValAssign</a> &amp; VA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign">CCValAssign</a> &amp; NextVA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> &amp; Root, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86subtarget">X86Subtarget</a> &amp; Subtarget, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> &#42; InGlue=nullptr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Reads two 32 bit registers and creates a 64 bit mask value.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="VA">The current 32 bit value that need to be assigned.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="NextVA">The next 32 bit value that need to be assigned.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Root">The parent DAG node.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[inout] InGlue">Represents SDvalue in the parent DAG node for glue purposes. In the case the DAG is already using physical register instead of virtual, we should glue our new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> to InGlue SDvalue.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
a new SDvalue of size 64bit.
</SectionUser>

<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/vectortype">VectorType</a> &#42;VTy = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;VectorType&gt;</a>(Ty)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MaxAlign == 16)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return the desired alignment for ByVal aggregate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function arguments in the caller parameter area. For X86, aggregates</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that contain SSE vectors are placed at 16-byte boundaries while the rest</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are at 4-byte boundaries.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86targetlowering/#a4fcc58c4d285835e0ac6fc644012b0be"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86targetlowering/#a4fcc58c4d285835e0ac6fc644012b0be">X86TargetLowering::getByValTypeAlignment</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                               </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Subtarget.is64Bit())</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment(4);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Subtarget.hasSSE1())</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It returns EVT::Other if the type should be determined using generic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// target-independent logic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// For vector ops we check that the overall size isn&#39;t larger than our</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// preferred vector width.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86targetlowering/#a53dee73973a09e035447943bb5bde29e"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt">EVT</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86targetlowering/#a53dee73973a09e035447943bb5bde29e">X86TargetLowering::getOptimalMemOpType</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/memop">MemOp</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AttributeList &amp;FuncAttributes)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!FuncAttributes.hasFnAttr(Attribute::NoImplicitFloat)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.size() &gt;= 16 &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">        (!Subtarget.isUnalignedMem16Slow() || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.isAligned(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(16)))) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Check if unaligned 64-byte accesses are slow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.size() &gt;= 64 &amp;&amp; Subtarget.hasAVX512() &amp;&amp; Subtarget.hasEVEX512() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Check if unaligned 32-byte accesses are slow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.size() &gt;= 32 &amp;&amp; Subtarget.hasAVX() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">          Subtarget.useLight256BitInstructions()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Although this isn&#39;t a well-supported type for AVX1, we&#39;ll let</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// legalization and shuffle lowering produce the optimal codegen. If we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// choose an optimal type with a vector element larger than a byte,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// getMemsetStores() may create an intermediate splat (using an integer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiply) before we splat as a vector.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::v32i8;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Subtarget.hasSSE2() &amp;&amp; (Subtarget.getPreferVectorWidth() &gt;= 128))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::v16i8;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Can SSE1 handle a byte vector?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have SSE1 registers we should be able to use them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Subtarget.hasSSE1() &amp;&amp; (Subtarget.is64Bit() || Subtarget.hasX87()) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">          (Subtarget.getPreferVectorWidth() &gt;= 128))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::v4f32;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (((<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.isMemcpy() &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.isMemcpyStrSrc()) || <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.isZeroMemset()) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">               <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.size() &gt;= 8 &amp;&amp; !Subtarget.is64Bit() &amp;&amp; Subtarget.hasSSE2()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Do not use f64 to lower memcpy if source is string constant. It&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// better to use i32 to avoid the loads.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Also, do not use f64 to lower memset unless this is a memset of zeros.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The gymnastics of splatting a byte value into an XMM register and then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only using 8-byte stores (because this is a CPU with slow unaligned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 16-byte accesses) makes that a loser.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::f64;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is a compromise. If we reach here, unaligned accesses may be slow on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this target. However, creating smaller, aligned accesses could be even</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// slower and would certainly be a lot more code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Subtarget.is64Bit() &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.size() &gt;= 8)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::i64;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::i32;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86targetlowering/#a4458afa9d4b40fe7c439f81cd5481366"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86targetlowering/#a4458afa9d4b40fe7c439f81cd5481366">X86TargetLowering::isSafeMemOpType</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a> VT)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342" lineLink="#aec0a89ba2bd4f839f4509ff10117b85f"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aec0a89ba2bd4f839f4509ff10117b85f">isBitAligned</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, uint64&#95;t SizeInBits) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (VT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a45e76d44a189e456d52e37ba3dda0fce">getSizeInBits</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Copy the result values into the output registers.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Swift calling convention does not require we copy the sret argument</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into %rax/%eax for the return, and SRetReturnReg is not set for Swift.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All x86 ABIs require that for returning structs by value we copy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the sret argument into %rax/%eax (depending on ABI) for the return.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We saved the argument into a virtual register in the entry block,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// so now we copy the value out and into %rax/%eax.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Checking Function.hasStructRetAttr() here is insufficient because the IR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="882"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// may not have an explicit sret argument. If FuncInfo.CanLowerReturn is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// false, then an sret argument may be implicitly inserted in the SelDAG. In</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// either case FuncInfo-&gt;setSRetReturnReg() will have been called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/mem2reg-cpp/#a6fde3eb6ca09ddf2fd76432176d817bb">Register</a> SRetReg = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-memprofcontextdisambiguation-cpp-/#ab7b317804874313a6eaa944cc003698c">FuncInfo</a>-&gt;getSRetReturnReg()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When we have both sret and another return value, we should use the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// original Chain stored in RetOps&#91;0&#93;, instead of the current Chain updated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the above loop. If we only have sret, RetOps&#91;0&#93; equals to Chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For the case of sret and another return value, we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Chain&#95;0 at the function entry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Chain&#95;1 = getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;0) in the above loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we use Chain&#95;1 in getCopyFromReg, we will have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Val = getCopyFromReg(Chain&#95;1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Chain&#95;2 = getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;1, Val) from below</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;0) will be glued together with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;1, Val) into Unit A, getCopyFromReg(Chain&#95;1) will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="899"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in Unit B, and we will have cyclic dependency between Unit A and Unit B:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="900"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Data dependency from Unit B to Unit A due to usage of Val in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     getCopyToReg(Chain&#95;1, Val)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Chain dependency from Unit A to Unit B</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="904"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// So here, we use RetOps&#91;0&#93; (i.e Chain&#95;0) for getCopyFromReg.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="905"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> Val = DAG.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag/#a6551350658729b36c93362fcff19abab">getCopyFromReg</a>(RetOps&#91;0&#93;, dl, SRetReg,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="906"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetloweringbase/#a8aabf5d0aa80038973255ff2d1e1a9fc">getPointerTy</a>(MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a82dd10b626a629b9bb7d32d53a8e0884">getDataLayout</a>()));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00907" /><CodeLine lineNumber="907"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/mem2reg-cpp/#a6fde3eb6ca09ddf2fd76432176d817bb">Register</a> RetValReg</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00909" /><CodeLine lineNumber="909"><span class="doxyHighlight">        = (Subtarget.is64Bit() &amp;&amp; !Subtarget.isTarget64BitILP32()) ?</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// RAX/EAX now acts like a return value.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add the returned register to the CalleeSaveDisableRegs list. Don&#39;t do</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                C &amp; StdCall &amp; Fast Calling Convention implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  StdCall calling convention seems to be standard for many Windows&#39; API</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  routines and around. It differs from C calling convention just a little:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  callee should clean up the stack, not caller. Symbols should be also</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  decorated in some fancy way :) It doesn&#39;t support any vector arguments.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  For info on fast calling convention see Fast Calling Convention (tail call)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  implementation LowerX86&#95;32FastCCCallTo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Determines whether Args, either a set of outgoing arguments to a call, or a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// set of incoming args of a call, contains an sret pointer that the callee</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pops</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208" lineLink="#aa546b9d95bbcbc4590bbd3bfdafcf9c0"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aa546b9d95bbcbc4590bbd3bfdafcf9c0">hasCalleePopSRet</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;T&gt;</a> &amp;Args,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1209"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86subtarget">X86Subtarget</a> &amp;Subtarget) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not C++20 (yet), so no concepts available.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;assert</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(std::is&#95;same&#95;v&lt;T, ISD::OutputArg&gt; ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1212"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    std::is&#95;same&#95;v&lt;T, ISD::InputArg&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1213"><span class="doxyHighlight">                </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;requires ISD::OutputArg or ISD::InputArg&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Only 32-bit pops the sret.  It&#39;s a 64-bit world these days, so early-out</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for most compilations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Subtarget.is32Bit())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1218"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1219"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Args.empty())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1221"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1222"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1223"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Most calls do not have an sret argument, check the arg next.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1224"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> &amp;Flags = Args&#91;0&#93;.Flags;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2593"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="#a9df9cc3269d03373740e69dcb005d729">errorUnsupported</a>(DAG, dl,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2594"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Swift attributes can&#39;t be used with preserve&#95;none&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2599"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Handle result values, copying them out of physregs into vregs that we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2600"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// return.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2601"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> LowerCallResult(Chain, InGlue, CallConv, isVarArg, Ins, dl, DAG,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2602"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         InVals, RegMask);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2603"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2604"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2605"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2606"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                Fast Calling Convention (tail call) implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2607"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2608"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2609"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  Like std call, callee cleans arguments, convention except that ECX is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2610"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  reserved for storing the tail called function address. Only 2 registers are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2611"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  free for argument passing (inreg). Tail call optimization is performed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2612"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  provided:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2613"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                &#42; tailcallopt is enabled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2614"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//                &#42; caller/callee are fastcc</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2615"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  On X86&#95;64 architecture with GOT-style position independent code only local</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2616"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  (within module) calls are supported at the moment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2617"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  To keep the stack aligned according to platform abi the function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2618"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  GetAlignedArgumentStackSize ensures that argument delta is always multiples</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2619"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  of stack alignment. (Dynamic linkers need this - Darwin&#39;s dyld for example)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2620"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  If a tail called function callee has more arguments than the caller the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2621"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  caller needs to make sure that there is room to move the RETADDR to. This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2622"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  achieved by reserving an area the size of the argument delta right after the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2623"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  original RETADDR, but before the saved framepointer or the spilled registers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2624"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  e.g. caller(arg1, arg2) calls callee(arg1, arg2,arg3,arg4)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2625"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  stack layout:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2626"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    arg1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2627"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    arg2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2628"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    RETADDR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2629"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    &#91; new RETADDR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2630"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      move area &#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2631"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    (possible EBP)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2632"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ESI</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2633"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    EDI</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2634"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    local1 ..</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2635"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2636"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Make the stack size align e.g 16n + 12 aligned for a 16-byte align</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2637"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// requirement.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2638"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2932"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have bytes to pop, the callee must pop them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2933"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CalleePopMatches = CalleeWillPop &amp;&amp; BytesToPop == StackArgsSize;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2936"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (CalleeWillPop &amp;&amp; StackArgsSize &gt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2937"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we don&#39;t have bytes to pop, make sure the callee doesn&#39;t pop any.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2938"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
